Description: Corner of a furnshing textile in undyed wool; with a decoration in purple wool tapestry and blue brocade; fringes are preserved at one edge (c.6cm long) and one reinforced selvedges is on the left, other edges cut and ragged; 6cm above the fringe are two lines of supplementary weft in purple and blue wool and one decorative motif in the shape of a shaft of wheat in blue wool (7cm long); 11cm above the fringe are two plain purple bands in tapestry; 28cm above the fringe is another plain purple band with a pyramid-like motif, alternatively on each side of the band; above this band are scattered geometrical motifs (shape of lozenge with a beige dot in the centre), five are preserved; plain weave:warp-undyed wool (S/8), weft-undyed wool (S/18); tapestry on single threads: warp-undyed wool (S/8), weft-purple and dark blue wool (S/60); brocade: light blue wool (S/paired/over 2 under 1)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
